title: February blues? Try yellows, reds or greens to brighten decor
text:
Armchair P4 by Josef Frank for Svenskt Tenn €1,380

This bentwood design is being produced for the first time, based on an original 1920s sketch that was preserved in the Swedish interior design shop's archive. svenskttenn.se

Welcome cupboard by Matthew Raw for the New Craftsmen £7,200

Clad in handmade glazed tiles, this piece takes inspiration from the designs of Britain's railway stations. thenewcraftsmen.com

Sunflower vase by Caroline Zimbalist £310

A bioplastic design made from gelatin and glycerine that makes a statement when displaying flowers. 12thirteen-store.com

Ripple Box by Jonathan Adler from £98

These high-gloss, lacquered storage boxes can be bought individually or as a set. uk.jonathanadler.com

Coasters by Adam Nathaniel Furman for Mirrl £48

As each piece is handmade, no two are the same, making these a unique purchase for the home. shop.mirrl.com

Scalloped coffee table by Edition 94 £995

Create a playful focal point in your living room with this hand-lacquered coffee table with a high-gloss finish. theedition94.com

Entwine rug by Maria Jeglinska for TRAME from €1,490

There is a also a ceramic collection to complement this rug, which is hand-knotted in Morocco. trameparis.com

Chachacha pouf by Houtique €387

Available in three colourways, this fringed pouf is inspired by the rhythm and movement of the Cuban dance. pleasurebyann.com

Queenie dressing screen by Matthew Williamson for Roome London
£5,500

Handmade in the UK, this botanical design has a brass frame and is upholstered in a silk-blend satin. roomelondon.com

Beice armchair by Merve Kahraman £4,294

Designed and manufactured in Turkey, this contemporary piece has a choice of frame in American walnut or white oak. 1stdibs.com

Aami Aami mug by Yinka Ilori £32

The designer has added his signature style to the classic enamel mug, bringing a pop of colour to the kitchen. yinkailori.com
